intro: Conyza scabrida, commonly known as roughleaf fleabane, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Its leaves are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving them a rough texture. Conyza scabrida produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
